Author: eru
Content:
So? Fixing inflation is at least as good a goal as fixing interest rates.

(It is probably better.)

Your argument reversed:

"All you can do by [letting rates of inflation change] is shift the benefit and the pain from some people to some other people - and back again the next time you tweak it."

Author: edu
Content:
I switched to a trackball a couple of months ago. I own the Logitech Cordless TrackMan Wheel: http://www.logitech.com/index.cfm/mice_pointers/trackballs/d...

It's a pretty awesome piece of hardware, big and very comfortable and with a nice touch. It uses an optical sensor so almost no cleaning is needed. Being cordless, the battery is not a problem as you're not supposed to move it around.

Author: nertzy
Content:
This is a Mac-only plugin, so I think evince doesn't really apply.

Most Mac users would probably rather use the built-in PDF libraries, which form the basis of Mac OS X's graphics system. They are well implemented, fast, and work great without the mess of plugin chrome you get from Adobe Reader. And the output looks great.

It's all about preventing people from needing to context-switch into application-switching and file management just to view a document.
